definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond

sentences.english: The raids will not， by themselves， make too much of a dent in the activities of triad gangs.
sentences.chinese: 掃蕩行動本身不會對黑社會活動造成太大打擊。

sentences.english: The big clean-out that sweeps across China north began.
sentences.chinese: 席捲華北的大掃蕩開始了。

sentences.english: Moreover, official publications have expressed caution about putting the sweeping rules into effect.
sentences.chinese: 官方出版物正在對這項“掃蕩”計劃的出臺做着辯白。

sentences.english: The way of public management of sexuality perhaps will shift from mopping up to regulation.
sentences.chinese: 性的公共管理學路向，將可能從掃蕩走向管理。

sentences.english: A loud buzz swept into street .
sentences.chinese: 一陣亂響的嗡嗡聲，以掃蕩之勢衝入街心。

sentences.english: Player but individual or group group undertake clean-out .
sentences.chinese: 玩家可個人或組隊進行掃蕩。

sentences.english: This is the primary reason I choose sweeps for harmonic distortion testing.
sentences.chinese: 這是主要的原因，我選擇諧波失真測試掃蕩。

sentences.english: Japanese raided the guerilla's base in the Shuangyashan Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 敵人掃蕩了雙鴨山的游擊隊根據地。

sentences.english: It will strike down my enemies wherever they may hide.
sentences.chinese: 它將掃蕩敵人直至其無處可藏。

sentences.english: Army's coming in to wipe out all these bonus people down here.'
sentences.chinese: 軍隊要去那邊掃蕩那些討償抗議人了。

sentences.english: He's tall, super skinny, and with that big mop of curls.
sentences.chinese: 他的身高，超瘦，並與大掃蕩的。

sentences.english: The fourth truth is " Mopping up plain - clothed soldiers was a battle action."
sentences.chinese: 第四個真相是，“掃蕩便衣士兵是戰爭行爲。”

sentences.english: A small army engineering squad sweeps for mines in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 小軍工程隊掃蕩礦在山上。

sentences.english: I'll do a sweep of the area. but I think these bastards are done.
sentences.chinese: 我要掃蕩這裏，但我想這些混蛋已經完了。

sentences.english: Becouse if i had to, i'd wipe out the whole planet to get mine back.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以，我寧願掃蕩整個星球找回我的家人。

sentences.english: A day, the enemy mopped up south roll Long Cun, wang Er's small home was destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 一天，敵人掃蕩了南滾龍村，王二小的家被毀了。

definition: to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
